page.title: 10NW.SHERBORNE:BUILDINGS (2)
page.content: Quarr Lane and Blackberry Lane border what was once a{quarry.}After the quarry had been worked out the council used the land as a{refuse tip. The tip was subsequently grassed over and is now being used for a variety of purposes. At one end there is a residential{caravan site,}further down is an{adventure playground,}then two large modern huts used as{headquarters one by the Army Cadets and the other by the Sherborne Boy Scouts. In the area are two disused {chapels,}one, a brick building, has been converted for a small business premises, the other, a corrugated iron structure is used as a second-hand furniture store. A row of stone-built stables, once part of a farm, has been converted into attractive{lock-up garages.}
